curam.util.client.model
Interface Binding

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public interface Binding
extends java.io.Serializable

An interface that defines the binding between a field and source and target data.

Method Summary
 Path getOptionsAliasPath()
           Gets the options alias path for this binding.
 Path getOptionsPath()
           Gets the options path for this binding.
 Path getSourceAliasPath()
           Gets the source alias path for this binding.
 Path getSourcePath()
           Gets the source path for this binding.
 Path getTargetPath()
          Gets the target path for this binding.
 

Method Detail

getSourcePath

Path getSourcePath()

Gets the source path for this binding. This resolves to the value that is displayed to the user unless the source alias path is present. When an options path is present and used to populate a list of values, the source value will be the initially selected value in that list. The source path always resolves to the same type of data that will be assigned to the target path (if a target path is present).

A source path will never resolve to a list of values. While the source may be a list, the path provided will resolve to only one value in that list (i.e., it will be indexed).

Returns:
The source path, or null if there is no path.

getSourceAliasPath

Path getSourceAliasPath()

Gets the source alias path for this binding. When present, this path is resolved to the value that is shown to the user instead of the value from the source path value. A source path will always be present along with this path. When no options path is present, the combination of this path with a source path is typical of a pop-up field control and a target path should also be present. This alias value is never assigned to a target path, as it is likely to be of a different type.

A source alias path will never resolve to a list of values.

Returns:
The source alias path, or null if there is no path.

getOptionsPath

Path getOptionsPath()

Gets the options path for this binding. This is only present when there is a target path. The options path resolves to a collection of values, one of which may be selected and assigned to the target path. When a source path is present, it will indicate the initially selected value in the list of options. If the options alias path is present, then the list will show the alias values, but one of the non-alias options values will be assigned to the target. The options path always resolves to the same type of data as the target path.

When the target path resolves to a code-table domain, then the options path will resolve to code-table code values. Typically, the options should then be presented by translating these code values to localized descriptions, though selecting an option will assign a code value to the target path. For code-table targets, there may not be a separate options alias path value to provide these descriptions and they must be generated by the renderer if required. However, if there is a separate options alias path, then it should be used in preference to generating the descriptions.

The options path will always resolve to a list of values (though that list may be empty).

Returns:
The options path, or null if there is no path.

getOptionsAliasPath

Path getOptionsAliasPath()

Gets the options alias path for this binding. This is only present when there is a target path and an options path. This path resolves to a collection of values that will be shown in a list of options, but a corresponding non-alias options value will actually be assigned to the target. The source alias path is not used for the initial selection of the options alias; only the source path and options path are combined for that purpose. This options alias values are never assigned to a target path, as they are likely to be of a different type.

The options alias path will always resolve to a list of values (though that list may be empty). The items in this list will have a one-to-one relationship with the items in the options list.

Returns:
The options alias path, or null if there is no path.

getTargetPath

Path getTargetPath()
Gets the target path for this binding. Values entered or selected by the user will be assigned to this target path. A target path will never resolve to a list of values.

Returns:
The target path, or null if there is no path.
